definition: Ferdinand von Richthofen (1833-1905), German geologist and explorer who published a major foundational study of the geology of China in 1887 and first introduced the term Silk Road 絲綢之路|丝绸之路
Sven Hedin (1865-1952), famous Swedish adventurer and archaeologist, whose 1894-1900 Central Asian expeditions uncovered Kroraina or Loulan 樓蘭|楼兰
Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
Nikolai Mikhailovich Przevalski (1839-1888), Russian explorer who made four expeditions to Central Asian from 1870/abbr. to 普氏
pinyin: Pu3 er3 re4 wa3 er3 si1 ji1

definition: Stein (name)/Marc Aurel Stein (1862-1943), British adventurer and archaeologist who explorer Xinjiang in early 20th century
William A.P. Martin (1827-1916), American missionary who lived 62 years in China between 1850 and 1916, and helped found many Chinese colleges, first president of Peking University
Matteo Ricci (1552-1610), Jesuit missionary and translator in Ming China
François Xavier d'Entrecolles (1664-1741), French Jesuit missionary to Kangxi court
Matteo Ricci (1552-1610), Jesuit missionary and translator in Ming China/erroneous spelling of 利瑪竇|利玛窦
